definition: to an extreme degree, lasting a very short time, success in satisfying a test or requirement
details:
adverb
- to an extreme degree
= synonyms: extremely, exceedingly, super, screamingly
adjective
- lasting a very short time
= synonyms: transient, ephemeral, short-lived, transitory, fugacious
- hasty and without attention to detail
= synonyms: casual
- of advancing the ball by throwing it
= synonyms: pass
- allowing you to pass (e.g., an examination or inspection) satisfactorily
noun
- success in satisfying a test or requirement
= example: success in satisfying a test or requirement
= synonyms: pass
- going by something that is moving in order to get in front of it
= example: going by something that is moving in order to get in front of it
= synonyms: overtaking
- (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
= example: (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
= synonyms: pass
- a bodily reaction of changing from one place or stage to another
= synonyms: passage
- the end of something
= example: the end of something
- the motion of one object relative to another
= example: the motion of one object relative to another
= synonyms: passage
- euphemistic expression for death
= example: euphemistic expression for death
= synonyms: exit
